definitions.text: a stout length of sawn timber; made in a wide variety of sizes and used for many purposes
a flat piece of material designed for a special purpose
examples: he nailed boards across the windows

definitions.text: a vertical surface on which information can be displayed to public view
a table at which meals are served
examples: he helped her clear the dining table
a feast was spread upon the board

definitions.text: electrical device consisting of a flat insulated surface that contains switches and dials and meters for controlling other electrical devices
examples: suddenly the board lit up like a Christmas tree

definitions.text: a printed circuit that can be inserted into expansion slots in a computer to increase the computer's capabilities
a flat portable surface (usually rectangular) designed for board games
examples: he got out the board and set up the pieces

definitions.text: get on board of (trains, buses, ships, aircraft, etc.)
live and take one's meals at or in
examples: she rooms in an old boarding house
The old lady is boarding three men
